hotspots.label: LED Light Bulb
hotspots.fact: This tiny LED light is glowing brightly! LEDs use much less electricity than regular bulbs and stay cool to the touch, making them super efficient and safe.

hotspots.label: Red Wire
hotspots.fact: The red wire carries positive electrical current to the LED. Red wires are a standard color choice in electronics because they help scientists and engineers quickly identify the positive side of a circuit.

hotspots.label: Battery Unit
hotspots.fact: This battery provides the electrical energy needed to light up the LED. The +D marking shows this is a special-sized battery that stores chemical energy and converts it into electricity!

hotspots.label: Circuit Connection
hotspots.fact: When the tweezers complete the circuit by touching both ends, electricity flows from the battery through the red wire to light the LED. A complete circuit is needed for electricity to flow!
